intro: Cephaelis ernestii, commonly known as the red-flowered celandine, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, bright red flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cephaelis ernestii is typically found in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations.
